title: Typography
description: Modular scale (1.2 ratio) with 8px grid-snapped line-heights. Responsive breakpoints at 730px and 1080px adjust heading sizes.

sections.title: Type Scale
sections.description: Font sizes follow a 1.2 (Minor Third) modular scale from 12px to 40px. All line-heights snap to 8px multiples.

sections.title: Headings
sections.description: Headings use semantic tokens and adjust size at breakpoints.

sections.title: Body Text
sections.description: Default body text at 16px with 24px line-height (1.5x ratio).

examples.html:
Body text at 16px with 24px line-height. The bold text and inline code maintain the same rhythm.

Body small at 14px with 24px line-height for secondary text.

sections.title: Text Roles
sections.description: Semantic text styles for specific use cases.

examples.html: Lead paragraph - 20px / 32px. Use for opening paragraphs or article intros.

examples.description: Eyebrow - 12px uppercase with wide tracking. Use above headings for categorization.

examples.html: Caption text - 12px / 16px. Use for labels, hints, and metadata.

Normal (400) - Body text

Medium (500) - Labels, small headings

Semibold (600) - Subheadings

Bold (700) - Headlines, emphasis

sections.title: Letter Spacing
sections.description: Three tracking options based on use case.

examples.html:
Display tracking (-0.02em)

Body tracking (0) - default

Caps tracking (+0.08em)

sections.title: Line Length
sections.description: Constrain text width for optimal readability (45-75 characters).

examples.html: This paragraph is constrained to 65ch max-width for optimal reading comfort. Long lines of text are harder to read because the eye has difficulty tracking back to the start of the next line.

sections.title: Responsive Behavior
sections.description: Headings scale down on mobile (<730px) and up on desktop (>1080px).
